p: These and other studies report of bioactive compounds derived from S. fulvellum with immunomodulatory and anti-inflammatory properties. However, the effect of S. fulvellum on immunoinflammatory activities and its underlying molecular mechanisms have not been studied and remain largely unresolved. Further studies are required to determine the anti-inflammatory potential of S. fulvellum extracts and their application in food and pharmaceutical products. These extracts should be further purified and characterized to possibly identify the relationship between their anti-inflammatory role and chemical structure, which would provide a novel insight into the application of S. fulvellum in the development of alternative anti-inflammatory drugs.
